title.rendered: How to Get Germany Visa Sponsorship Jobs

content.rendered:
Have you ever aspired to relocate to Germany for employment and a new beginning? This dream can become a reality, particularly when Germany confronts a labour shortage. The nation is presently dealing with a substantial workforce shortage, which opens doors for foreign individuals who wish to explore visa sponsorship jobs in Germany.

In Germany, skilled professionals are welcomed in various fields but must have a sponsor to facilitate the visa process. These visa sponsorship jobs are only offered by German companies that have received government authorization. The average salary for skilled workers is approximately EUR 8,000 per month, making it an attractive destination for those seeking employment. Regardless of nationality, individuals interested in these opportunities can apply for German visa sponsorship jobs if they are willing to work in Germany.

There are several options if you plan to move to Germany. As an international student, you can explore scholarship opportunities to study in Germany. If you are a skilled professional aspiring to build your career in Germany, you can use the German Visa Sponsorship Programs extended by different German companies. This article offers a compilation of such companies and guidance on applying for their visa sponsorships.

By 2035, Germany is projected to face a shortage of roughly 7 million skilled workers. In reaction to this, the German government is proactively simplifying immigration processes, rendering Germany an increasingly attractive choice for skilled foreign workers from various parts of the world.

Although numerous employment opportunities are available in fields such as electrical engineering, information technology, medicine, nursing, caregiving, and hospitality, prospective foreign applicants frequently have questions about the application procedure. If you are aware of the initial steps, it’s a reasonably straightforward process.

Commonly available jobs in Germany:

A wide range of job opportunities are available in Germany for visa sponsorship, including positions in:

  • Healthcare and Nursing
  • Information Technology (IT)
  • Engineering
  • Skilled Trades
  • Education
  • Hospitality and Tourism
  • Construction
  • Automotive Industry
  • Agriculture and Farming
  • Healthcare Support

German Companies Offering Visa Sponsorships

Several German companies have the approval to offer visa sponsorship to foreign applicants; some currently on that list are:

  • Daimler
  • Siemens
  • BMW
  • Volkswagen
  • Bayer
  • Porsche
  • BASF
  • Adidas
  • Continental
  • Henkel
  • Merck
  • Allianz
  • Deutsche Bank
  • SAP
  • Robert Bosch

Applying for German Visa Sponsorship Jobs

The first step to applying for visa sponsorship jobs in Germany is to locate the jobs. Several platforms are available that applicants can take advantage of to find and apply for these jobs:

Use the EURES Portal (European Employment Services):

The EURES Portal is a platform that lists current jobs in Germany that are available to applicants around the globe. The platform collaborates with governmental employment agencies to make that possible. There are about 863,251 job listings in various fields, including full-time, part-time, and short-term positions.

Steps to Apply:

  • Filter job listings by language (English or German).
  • Use search terms (e.g., “Visa Sponsorship”) to explore suitable job openings.
  • Check your eligibility for the jobs and submit your application as appropriate.

  • How to Get a Job in Marketing with a Professional Degree in Canada, USA

Top 5 Companies You Can Apply Directly to:

1. Airbus Jobs in Germany:

  • Airbus offers jobs and internships to students, and candidates from any country are welcome to apply.
  • Positions come with a monthly compensation package of €1,000, including allowances and accommodation. More Info

2. Amazon Jobs in Germany:

  • Amazon employs a diverse workforce and offers positions in various locations across Germany.
  • They welcome individuals from different educational backgrounds and fields. More Info

3. Quantitative Analyst (CEPRES):

  • CEPRES, a digital fundraising platform, offers competitive salaries and visa sponsorship.
  • They provide relocation assistance, team events, and a modern office. More Info

4. Mercedes-Benz Jobs in Germany:

  • Mercedes-Benz offers numerous opportunities for students, graduates, and professionals.
  • They have scholar programs, graduate programs, and internships available. More Info

5. Siemens Germany:

  • Siemens offers various roles for students in engineering, manufacturing, research and development, IT, sales, and marketing.
  • With around 113,000 employees in Germany, Siemens is a significant employer.

You can also explore other top companies, such as Google Jobs, Microsoft Careers, BMW Group Jobs, and Apple Germany, which all offer visa sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Please remember that applications for Germany visa sponsorship jobs are processed on a first-come, first-served basis, and there isn’t a fixed deadline. Therefore, the sooner you apply, the more advantageous it is. We also encourage you to consider applying for as many opportunities as you can. Best of luck with your endeavours
